pullRequest.body:
Also fix the silly `EMetricSpace` docstring.

From my PhD (MiscYD)


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [efa8f94cac](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23106/commits/efa8f94cacc63ad584ba0983b683845cdb231614)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ EMetric.closedBall_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This doesn't quite make sense as a docstring on this decl, since it doesn't immediately extend UniformSpace. What about adding a clause to this sentence that it does these things by virtue of extending `PseudoEMetricSpace`.
What about simply replacing `PseudoEMetricSpace` with `EMetricSpace` everywhere?

Then we'll end up in a situation where the docstring for EMetricSpace is just a find/replace on the docstring for PseudoEMetricSpace, which is definitely not what we want. Have you considered writing a docstring here instead of copying it from something else?

Well I think it's easier to maintain two docstrings that look the same rather than two docstrings that are different for no deep reason. That's called "uniformisation".

In fact, I fail to understand why the docstring for `PseudoMetricSpace` is any different to the one for `PseudoEMetricSpace`.

Docstrings on different declarations should be different: the point is to explain what the declarations are doing. If the best description you have for them both is identical, then they shouldn't be different declarations at all. Uniformisation in terms of format is good, but it's actively harmful in terms of content when it comes to documentation.
The comment about instantiating a PseudoEMetric space structure appears unhelpful here, since someone reading this decl isn't trying to do that. It looks like you miscopied something?

pullRequest.title: feat(EMetric): `closedBall x 0 = {x}`
